text: Quand je suis rentré dans la boutique j'ai juste fait  : "whoo" et j'ai tout regardé. Le mur rempli de boite de thé en métal. avec une échelle comme on voit dans les bibliothèque. Juste ça, ça a de la gueule.   Les employés (proprio?) connaissent vraiment leurs produits et vous dirigent selon vos gouts.  Ce que j'ai trouvé le plus impressionnant c'est qu'ils vont chercher le thé dans les boites qui n'ont rien écrit dessus, ils savent où se trouve chaque thé, et non il ne le font pas au hasard car il nous montre bien l'étiquette à l'interieur de la boite avant de nous servir.  On a aussi eu droit à une petite dégustation, je ne me souvient plus du thé mais il était vraiment bon.

After visiting the nearby market, I was pleasantly surprised to find a branch of this store nearby. I should note that despite this being my first review, I'm a rather obsessive tea drinker and student, having visited some of the best on the east coast.  I can easily say that, even despite it's size, this is one of the nicest tea shops I've ever been in.  The gentlemen behind the counter was very gracious, curious and accommodating, helping me pick an appropriately priced Darjeeling, letting me smell the leaves and discussing my tastes, quickly switching to English for me. The prices here are very good for the quality of the tea and the teaware and the selection is impeccably curated.  I bought the aforementioned Darjeeling and a travel brewing mug and thought the prices were very fair, if a bit of a bargain. I would be extremely happy to have a shop like this in my town.

I absolutely love this place! They have a pretty good tea selection and the ambience is wonderful. They also have these delicious pastries that goes wonderfully with your tea. This place is where I want to spend a nice relaxing Sunday at. However, this place is a tech-free zone, so you can't bring your laptop or use your phone within the shop. It's a shame because this would have been my ideal study spot.
